children.text:
The provided code uses a dynamic programming approach with coordinate compression and two Fenwick trees (or segment trees) to optimize the DP transitions. The DP state is defined as:
  dp[i] = maximum total value we can get for the prefix ending at position i. The recurrence is:
  dp[i] = max( 
        dp[j] + (i - j)   if the sum of a[j+1..i] > 0,
        dp[j]             if the sum of a[j+1..i] = 0,
        dp[j] - (i - j)   if the sum of a[j+1..i] < 0
  ) for all j in [0, i-1]

But note: the value of the segment from j+1 to i is:
        (i - j) if pref[i] - pref[j] > 0,
        0 if pref[i] - pref[j] == 0,
        -(i - j) if pref[i] - pref[j] < 0.

We can rewrite:
  dp[i] = max( 
        dp[j] + (i - j)   for j such that pref[i] > pref[j],
        dp[j]             for j such that pref[i] = pref[j],
        dp[j] - (i - j)   for j such that pref[i] < pref[j]
  )

But note: (i - j) = i - j, so we can rearrange: For pref[i] > pref[j]: dp[j] - j + i
  For pref[i] < pref[j]: dp[j] + j - i
  For pref[i] = pref[j]: dp[j] (which is the same as dp[j] - j + i? but then we have to subtract i?
